text: info after the video
[Music]
new super mario bros zoo deluxe has more
to offer beyond the main game and that
of course is all the challenges i know
the boost block stages aren't in the
switch version but i never found any of
those that hard and deluxe just looks a
tad bit better anyway but regardless
each level in this challenge mode could
be considered difficult if we're basing
it off getting a gold medal so this is
based more on a general sense of what
the task is and what the obstacles are
so without further ado let's go
our first level involves lots and lots
of climbing stone slide tower climb has
you completing the castle from world 2
in under 90 seconds or less and for most
of the challenges you aren't going to be
allowed to get hit at any point so it's
good to keep that in mind as an extra
barrier that mario has to endure now
normally this level isn't that bad if
you just take your time and kill enemies
along the way but obviously you can't do
that here if you make one or two
mistakes you're either not gonna make it
to the top or it'll be a really close
call and since you have to move fast it
makes it a lot easier to make dumb
mistakes like falling into the sand or
running into an enemy and things like
that you kind of just have to learn how
to create your own shortcuts like
spinning these wheels for like a second
instead of just sticking the whole
platform out like you'd normally do
figuring this out and improving your
time is quite thrilling and exciting but
it can also be frustrating when you keep
dying over the dumbest things the end is
definitely the hardest part because the
wall jumps you have to do to get up
faster than usual can be quite tricky to
pull off correctly this one is so high
on the list because there's only some
moments where things can get complicated
a lot of the stage just requires weld
type jumps and nothing beyond that and
believe me we're just scratching the
surface
i really debated on putting this one on
the list and some of you may not agree
but i freaking hate the haunted
propeller this is probably the shortest
challenge on our list you basically have
to beat the level in 50 seconds or less
while using the propeller suit and you
might think that using such an op
power-up would make this really easy but
as we've already seen there's circles of
booze all over the place and some of
them detract and expand making it harder
to predict their movement while i've
completed this challenge a few times the
sheer nature of the propeller suit
requires you to understand its physics
perfectly and having a great reaction
time too when you fly up into the air
you fly and shoot off like a goddamn
rocket with some practice the first half
of this level isn't that bad it's the
ending that grinds my gears you go up a
few floors and there's like three or
four of these circling boots that
overlap with each other so you have to
perfectly time your propeller jump or
you'll get hit and have to start all
over depending on when you get to this
part it can either be easy or insanely
hard maybe i'm just bad at using this
power-up but i found myself constantly
getting hit by booze when i felt like i
was far enough away from it
have you ever seen those videos where
youtubers try to not collect coins you
may or may not have castle coin bypass
basically introduces the idea through
this challenge the goal here is to not
touch a single coin however you are
allowed to grab five but you get
penalized the more you grab you'd think
this wouldn't be that big a deal but the
coins are put in some of the most
ridiculous places especially on these
swinging platforms near the beginning
like look at how precise your jump has
to be to avoid all these it's ridiculous
you can use dry bones to hop over these
particular coins but your timing has to
be immaculate to make that happen the
middle part of the level is just as
ridiculous as you have to avoid
fireballs and carefully time your jumps
to avoid those stupid evil coins even
the question mark blocks have coins in
them so you can't hit those either but
with that said i found the ending to be
the easiest the coins weren't placed
that awkwardly and i just had to make
really tiny jumps to get through it this
isn't the worst avoiding coins challenge
in the game but there's some parts that
make me want to chuck my controller into
the backyard
yep just like that
i'm not gonna lie i feel pretty screwed
over half the time i'm playing screw top
it up this is another challenge where
you're climbing a tower and you gotta do
it under 90 seconds but the enemies this
time around are much more gruesome most
of the time you have to spin yourself on
these screw based platforms and to get
through this level at all you need to
spin pretty optimally or you'll lose too
much time and not make it you got to
avoid all these boneheads that shoot
spikes through their shell if you get
too close and there's so many sumo bros
now sumo bros can't be stepped on they
move erratically and when they stomp
their foot waves of electricity shoots
underneath killing you instantly if you
touch it the movement i have to do for
this stage requires much more precision
than any of the other levels we've
talked about like this part here the
fastest way i've found to get through
this is to jump on this coin block and
spin jump at just the right time so i
can avoid the sumo bros and the bony
beetle and there really aren't that many
shortcuts to make compared to the other
climbing levels you just need pure skill
to get through this making the jump over
this sumo bro near the end is insanely
hard now sure you could kill him first
but that takes longer so to save time
you have to jump near perfect to avoid
his spiky head and get across in the
very end with all the fire bars is just
dreadful you make all this progress and
you just want to finish but instead the
freaking fire bars get in your way half
the time and you either get hit by them
or you have to wait until they move out
of the way and as if this level didn't
throw enough crap at you after the fire
bars is a sumo bro waiting at the top
that fires electricity almost the second
you arrive now i was paying attention so
i didn't get hit by him but like come on
that's a cheap shot you barely have
enough time to know he's even gonna be
there this is one of those levels that
just genuinely angers me its sole
purpose in life is to make you feel
cheated on
a few of the challenges in this game
have some really cool ideas like this
one where you have to jump off a bunch
of goombas consecutively to get lives
this is a really clever way to utilize
enemies and is an official nod from
nintendo to those that have discovered
the one-up tricks in previous mario
games but then there's paratroopa panic
which is the same idea but done in the
most sadistic way possible at first
glance it looks like a cakewalk you got
five pair of troopas so what do you do
you bounce the wings off all them and
then you bounce on them again and then
you realize that this is way harder than
it looks the koopas take like five weeks
to come out of their shell again and the
only way to get a medal at all is to get
four one ups and this is the problem
because bouncing on every paratroopa
twice only gets you three completing
this level requires you to place
paratroopas in extremely specific spots
and you have to figure out how to waste
as much time as possible jumping on them
so you'll have time to wall jump and hit
them again and you really don't have
much room to wall jump either because
the walls are relatively short i have
beat this level one time but it kind of
felt like a miracle the title just
speaks for itself i am in a panic
whenever i attempt this challenge i feel
like no matter how well i think i'm
doing it just doesn't want to work
getting this money mold to stay on this
floating platform all the way until the
end of the level is a brilliant concept
and makes for a frantically fun time but
then there's multi-goal returns which
takes the same concept flips it on its
head and laughs at you knowing how much
you're gonna die to this the biggest
hurdle is just the amount of
multitasking you have to do let's just
analyze everything that i need to think
about while playing this i need to make
sure i don't fall in the lava don't
touch monty mole don't hit the fireballs
or the blogs or i'm gonna die i also
have to do this fast because there's
looming poison coming in from behind but
then there's mini gumas that can stop
the ride so i have to take care of them
too so i gotta stomp on the goombas or
spin jump them off me all while making
sure i don't get hit by anything else so
don't accidentally step on the money
mole all at the same time and then the
end throws in a buzzy beetle that falls
from the ceiling and homes in on the
monument so you have to jump on it and
throw it out of the way while montemol
is constantly following you around i
guess if you're really good at
multitasking this one may not be that
bad but my god do i find this a pain to
complete
i don't know why all these challenges
have to be in castles but express
elevator is no different you have to
take the elevator all the way to the top
without getting a coin or enemy to touch
it the first obstacle is getting really
comfortable with turning the elevator
with motion controls and moving mario
with the d-pad this alone makes this
challenge way harder than it needs to be
it feels really unnatural doing this
when they could have just used oh i
don't know the shoulder buttons to move
the elevator anyway coins and bombs
often come down in parachutes and if
they touch electricity on the way then
the parachute breaks and it'll free-fall
on you the coins aren't that bad it's
the bombs that give you issues you can
freeze up a bomb and stop them in their
tracks but even if the ice block touches
the elevator it'll nab you a game over
so what you have to do is freeze any
bombs in your way as soon as possible
and run underneath and jump i really
struggle with this one for a while until
i realize that standing on the left side
really helps a lot there tends to be
less bombs on the left side and it just
feels a little less
cluttered yes this level looks exactly
the same as the one before and that's
because it is except that the elevator
is now out of service but that's okay
because mario does mario things like
using a p acorn suit which grants him
infinite flying abilities like the
propeller challenge from earlier this
seems like it'd be easy because the
power-up is incredibly useful and
versatile but controlling this thing
while avoiding all the falling bombs and
waves of electricity is such a chore now
maybe i'm just not that great using the
acorn suit but there's lots of moments
where you have to be in just the right
spot to avoid getting hit by anything i
always felt like i didn't have mario
positioned correctly so i'd always
undershoot or overshoot a flap jump and
hit something i wasn't supposed to if
you're someone that's really equipped
with the acorn suit i could see this
being a bit higher on your list but for
me this level gave me more trouble than
the other elevator one and i am done
talking about this castle level twice so
let's move on
to unlock cashless castle crawl you have
to get all the star coins in world 8
from the main game complete world 9 8
and beat the castle crawl challenge
where you aren't allowed to dash through
the entire level this is the same thing
where you can't dash but now you also
can't touch coins if you touch more than
5 or get hit by something you go back to
the beginning if you thought jumps had
to be tight in previous coinless
challenges those look like baby toys
compared to this whopping meal like look
at this set of three coins near the
beginning do you see how insanely hard
it is to avoid all these coins it
doesn't even look humanly possible i'm
almost always grabbing at least one on
the right end i have done it a few times
but most of the time i just accept that
i'm touching that coin and i gotta just
move on with my day and i should also
mention that throughout the entire level
you have to constantly walk forward or
jump in place because most of the blocks
fall underneath you if you stand for too
long and jumping in place is hard to do
when you have spiky balls that
continuously get in your way it's really
straining on your thumbs after playing
for a long time there's two parts in
particular that just boggle my mind
every time i see them this first one you
got two spike balls swinging back and
forth a platform with three little
blocks and a bony beetle to get through
this you have to do the tiniest jump
known to mankind to avoid getting hit
hope the beetle freezes up stand on this
block let it fall a bit jump when it's
falling and destroy the beetle hoping
you don't touch the coins up above and
this second part has the dumbest jump
i've ever seen and it's only dumb
because it's far away implying you need
to do a big jump to get across but the
coins are in the exact spot you need to
be in and since you're walking the whole
time this level is agonizingly slow to
get through and you have to be patient
the whole time but it's hard to do that
when you're constantly dying really the
whole level is painful but these two
parts push this very close to being
number one on the list but i think we
already know what number one is
[Music]
you know nintendo's being serious when
they add periods after every word and
for this challenge don't touch anything
nintendo rightfully titled this
differently from the others because they
knew they created a demon for this level
you aren't allowed to touch coins or
enemies you can grab up to 5 coins but
touching an enemy at all ends your game
the only positive thing i can say is
that we're finally not in a castle but i
almost want to go back because this
level is so stupidly daunting one of the
most annoying things about it are the
lakitu for most of the level you're
dealing with anywhere from one to three
liquido at a time and they all throw a
spines that get in your way but since
you can't jump on the lokito to stop
this from happening you just have to
accept your fate and pray this findings
are thrown in places where you can
actually avoid them the coins in this
level are the worst part all of them are
put in the most obnoxious spots possible
the worst being those moving alongside
the colored platforms like look at these
orange platforms the only way i can
avoid the coins is to run forward at the
perfect speed and time you can't mess up
your timing at all you're done for but
the ending is where most sane people
would just give up these red platforms
move so stupidly fast you literally have
to make pixel perfect jumps to avoid
touching any coins at all even after i
practiced a lot i kept losing at this
section and there was nothing i could do
except hope that i jumped praying
perfectly and as if this level didn't
have enough bs it has the audacity to
have an invisible coin block what the
hell is that all about what is this a
kaizo hack or an official mario game
after hundreds of tries i was able to
beat this but i grabbed four coins along
the way there's just a countless amount
of factors that get in your way like the
lack of dues throwing spineys the coin
placements the pixel perfect jumps it's
just straight up horrible and
unforgiving and with that guys thanks so
much for watching and i hope you enjoyed
until next time
[Music]
